trans-unit.source: PCA-Based Anomaly Detection
trans-unit.target: PCA-Based Anomaly Detection

trans-unit.source: Creates an anomaly detection model using Principal Component Analysis
trans-unit.target: Creates an anomaly detection model using Principal Component Analysis

trans-unit.source: Category: <link xlink:href="ae17795c-6437-47b5-9853-646d77d461b0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning\Initialize Model\Anomaly Detection</link>
trans-unit.target: Category: <link xlink:href="ae17795c-6437-47b5-9853-646d77d461b0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning\Initialize Model\Anomaly Detection</link>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>PCA-Based Anomaly Detection</ui> module to create an anomaly detection model based on Principal Component Analysis (PCA)
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>PCA-Based Anomaly Detection</ui> module to create an anomaly detection model based on Principal Component Analysis (PCA)

trans-unit.source: This module is designed for use in scenarios where it is easy to obtain training data from one class, such as acceptable transactions, but difficult to obtain sufficient samples of the targeted anomalies.
trans-unit.target: This module is designed for use in scenarios where it is easy to obtain training data from one class, such as acceptable transactions, but difficult to obtain sufficient samples of the targeted anomalies.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you need to detect fraudulent transaction, you might not have enough examples of fraud to train the mode, but have many examples of good transactions.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you need to detect fraudulent transaction, you might not have enough examples of fraud to train the mode, but have many examples of good transactions.

trans-unit.source: However, if you use the <ui>PCA-Based Anomaly Detection</ui> module, you can train the model using the available features to determine what constitutes a “normal” class, and then use distance metrics to identify cases that represent anomalies.
trans-unit.target: However, if you use the <ui>PCA-Based Anomaly Detection</ui> module, you can train the model using the available features to determine what constitutes a “normal” class, and then use distance metrics to identify cases that represent anomalies.

trans-unit.source: More about Principal Component Analysis
trans-unit.target: More about Principal Component Analysis

trans-unit.source: <newTerm>Principal Component Analysis (PCA)</newTerm> is an established technique in machine learning that can be applied to feature selection and classification.
trans-unit.target: <newTerm>Principal Component Analysis (PCA)</newTerm> is an established technique in machine learning that can be applied to feature selection and classification.

trans-unit.source: PCA is frequently used in exploratory data analysis because it reveals the inner structure of the data and explains the variance in the data.
trans-unit.target: PCA is frequently used in exploratory data analysis because it reveals the inner structure of the data and explains the variance in the data.

trans-unit.source: PCA converts a set of cases, containing possibly correlated variables, into a set of values called principal components.
trans-unit.target: PCA converts a set of cases, containing possibly correlated variables, into a set of values called principal components.

trans-unit.source: In the case of anomaly detection, for each new input, the anomaly detector first computes its projection on the eigenvectors, and then computes the normalized reconstruction error.
trans-unit.target: In the case of anomaly detection, for each new input, the anomaly detector first computes its projection on the eigenvectors, and then computes the normalized reconstruction error.

trans-unit.source: This normalized error is the anomaly score.
trans-unit.target: This normalized error is the anomaly score.

trans-unit.source: The higher the error, the more anomalous the instance is.
trans-unit.target: The higher the error, the more anomalous the instance is.

trans-unit.source: For additional information about how PCA works, and about implementations for use in anomaly detection, see these papers:
trans-unit.target: For additional information about how PCA works, and about implementations for use in anomaly detection, see these papers:

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>A randomized algorithm for principal component analysis</linkText><linkUri>http://arxiv.org/abs/0809.2274</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>A randomized algorithm for principal component analysis</linkText><linkUri>http://arxiv.org/abs/0809.2274</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Rokhlin, Szlan and Tygert
trans-unit.target: Rokhlin, Szlan and Tygert

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Finding Structure with Randomness: Probabilistic Algorithms for Constructing Approximate Matrix Decompositions</linkText><linkUri>http://users.cms.caltech.edu/~jtropp/papers/HMT11-Finding-Structure-SIREV.pdf</linkUri></externalLink> (PDF download).
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Finding Structure with Randomness: Probabilistic Algorithms for Constructing Approximate Matrix Decompositions</linkText><linkUri>http://users.cms.caltech.edu/~jtropp/papers/HMT11-Finding-Structure-SIREV.pdf</linkUri></externalLink> (PDF download).

trans-unit.source: Halko, Martinsson and Tropp.
trans-unit.target: Halko, Martinsson and Tropp.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure a PCA Anomaly Detection Model
trans-unit.target: How to Configure a PCA Anomaly Detection Model

trans-unit.source: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Training mode</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Training mode</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: If you know how you want to configure the model, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.
trans-unit.target: If you know how you want to configure the model, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.

trans-unit.source: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.
trans-unit.target: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.
trans-unit.target: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> will iterate over all possible combinations of the settings you provided and determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> will iterate over all possible combinations of the settings you provided and determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.

trans-unit.source: Specify the number of components desired in the final output, and the amount of resampling to perform on minority cases.
trans-unit.target: Specify the number of components desired in the final output, and the amount of resampling to perform on minority cases.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, add a tagged dataset and train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.

trans-unit.source: You can use the model trained using those parameters, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.
trans-unit.target: You can use the model trained using those parameters, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: You can customize the model by using the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: You can customize the model by using the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: Training mode
trans-unit.target: Training mode

trans-unit.source: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:
trans-unit.target: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.

trans-unit.source: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.

trans-unit.source: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.
trans-unit.target: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.

trans-unit.source: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.
trans-unit.target: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.

trans-unit.source: Number of components to use in PCA
trans-unit.target: Number of components to use in PCA

trans-unit.source: Type a value that specifies the total number of components to use.
trans-unit.target: Type a value that specifies the total number of components to use.

trans-unit.source: The decision of how many components to include is an important part of experiment design using PCA.
trans-unit.target: The decision of how many components to include is an important part of experiment design using PCA.

trans-unit.source: General guidance is that you should not include the same number of PCA components as there are variables, but should start with some smaller number of components and increase them until some criteria is met.
trans-unit.target: General guidance is that you should not include the same number of PCA components as there are variables, but should start with some smaller number of components and increase them until some criteria is met.

trans-unit.source: If you are unsure of what the optimum value might be, we recommend that you train the anomaly detection model using the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: If you are unsure of what the optimum value might be, we recommend that you train the anomaly detection model using the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Oversampling parameter for randomized PCA
trans-unit.target: Oversampling parameter for randomized PCA

trans-unit.source: Type a value to use as the oversampling parameter for randomized PCA training.
trans-unit.target: Type a value to use as the oversampling parameter for randomized PCA training.

trans-unit.source: In anomaly detection problems, imbalanced data makes it difficult to apply standard PCA techniques.
trans-unit.target: In anomaly detection problems, imbalanced data makes it difficult to apply standard PCA techniques.

trans-unit.source: By specifying some amount of oversampling, you can duplicate the target instance, and perform principal component analysis on an oversampled data set.
trans-unit.target: By specifying some amount of oversampling, you can duplicate the target instance, and perform principal component analysis on an oversampled data set.

trans-unit.source: Enable input feature mean normalization
trans-unit.target: Enable input feature mean normalization

trans-unit.source: Select this option to normalize all input features.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to normalize all input features.

trans-unit.source: This option is selected by default.
trans-unit.target: This option is selected by default.

trans-unit.source: Normalization (or standardization, or scaling) is generally recommended for PCA, because the goal of PCA is to maximize variance among variables.
trans-unit.target: Normalization (or standardization, or scaling) is generally recommended for PCA, because the goal of PCA is to maximize variance among variables.

trans-unit.source: However, you should deselect this option if values have already been normalized using a different method or scale.
trans-unit.target: However, you should deselect this option if values have already been normalized using a different method or scale.

trans-unit.source: Range for number of PCA components
trans-unit.target: Range for number of PCA components

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Training mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, use the Range Builder to drag the slider and show the completed range, and then indicate how many values to include in that range.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Training mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, use the Range Builder to drag the slider and show the completed range, and then indicate how many values to include in that range.

trans-unit.source: You can also type a comma-delimited series of values.
trans-unit.target: You can also type a comma-delimited series of values.

trans-unit.source: Range for the oversampling parameter used in randomized PCA
trans-unit.target: Range for the oversampling parameter used in randomized PCA

trans-unit.source: If you set the <ui>Training mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, use the Range Builder to drag the slider and show the completed range, and then indicate how many values to include in that range.
trans-unit.target: If you set the <ui>Training mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, use the Range Builder to drag the slider and show the completed range, and then indicate how many values to include in that range.

trans-unit.source: You can also type a comma-delimited series of values.
trans-unit.target: You can also type a comma-delimited series of values.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.target: For examples of how PCA is used in anomaly detection, see this sample experiment in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more specified columns have type unsupported by current module.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more specified columns have type unsupported by current module.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs when attempting to compare two models with different learner types.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs when attempting to compare two models with different learner types.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if number of feature columns in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if number of feature columns in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.
